articles.title: ‘Free America’: Anti-Trump Administration Protests Planned Across U.S. on July 4
articles.description: On July 4, 2025, protests against President Donald Trump's administration are planned across the U.S., replacing traditional Independence Day celebrations for many. These demonstrations build on a series of prior protests since Trump's re-election, including the June 14 'No Kings' protests opposing perceived authoritarianism, and nationwide immigration protests sparked by increased ICE raids and the controversial deployment of federal military forces in states like California. Women's March has organized over 140 events for 'Free America Weekend,' calling attention to critical issues such as poverty, discrimination, and fear-based politics. Additional demonstrations, dubbed 'No Kings 2.0,' will focus on immigration justice and solidarity, emphasizing non-violent action in several states. Protests are also expected outside Trump's Mar-a-Lago residence, featuring symbolic acts like flying a baby Trump balloon. Moreover, The People's Union USA urges a nationwide boycott of corporate July 4 events, encouraging local support and community action to protest wealth inequality and social injustices. These events represent a significant continuation of public dissent against Trump’s policies and perceived erosion of democratic freedoms.

articles.title: Seattle Named Second-Most Popular Fourth of July Domestic Travel Destination by AAA
articles.description: Seattle was ranked as the second-most popular domestic travel destination for the Fourth of July holiday this year, according to AAA. Seattle hotspots have seen notable crowds this week. Visitors at Pike Place Market shared their reasons for coming to Seattle, including hiking, escaping heat and humidity, and exploring the city before embarking on cruises.

articles.title: July 4, 2025: What Made Headlines Today
articles.description: A quick rundown of today’s biggest news stories, including Russia launching 550 drones and missiles on Ukraine overnight, injuring 23 in Kyiv; President Trump planning to send tariff letters to multiple countries; and Hamas reviewing a final Gaza ceasefire deal as Israel’s ministers praise the war on Iran as a defining moment in the nation’s history.
